poem:
The Hottest July

July, you've become a new flame,  
sultry and unrelenting,  
like an old stove someone forgot to turn off.  
The newspaper insists on your temperature,  
echoing the clamor of cooling fans  
and ice cubes dropping into lemonade—  
the world walking in a fevered dream,  
trying to remember the cool touch of spring.
